docs.snippet: THE FORTY-FIRST-STREET STABBING AFFRAY.DEATH OF ONE OF THE WOUNDED.-Coroner SCHEIMER held an inquest, yesterday, at the New-York Hospital upon the body of JOHN SAMMONS, one of the three men stabbed, on Thursday night, in Forty-first-street, in a...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE FORTY-FIRST-STREET STABBING AFFRAY.DEATH OF ONE OF THE WOUNDED.-Coroner SCHEIMER held an inquest, yesterday, at the New-York Hospital upon the body of JOHN SAMMONS, one of the three men stabbed, on Thursday night, in Forty-first-street, in a quarrel with three Germans. SAMMONS died at a late hour on Sunday night from the effects of the injuries then received.

docs.snippet: The Letter addressed by the Rev. THEODORE PARKER to the members of the Twenty-eighth Congregational Society of Boston, briefly announced among the items of personal gossip a few days since, has been published in a neat volume of 175 pages, by RUFUS...

headline.main: THEODORE PARKER'S AUTOBIOGRAPHY.; Mr. Parker's Letter to his Congregation--His Personal Reminiscences.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Letter addressed by the Rev. THEODORE PARKER to the members of the Twenty-eighth Congregational Society of Boston, briefly announced among the items of personal gossip a few days since, has been published in a neat volume of 175 pages, by RUFUS LEIGHTON, Jr., Boston.

docs.snippet: If any rash prophet had suggested to the Pilgrims of New-England two hundred years ago that their descendants would be called upon to decide for themselves the grave question whether a Christian State should or should not permit the Sabbath to be...
docs.lead_paragraph: If any rash prophet had suggested to the Pilgrims of New-England two hundred years ago that their descendants would be called upon to decide for themselves the grave question whether a Christian State should or should not permit the Sabbath to be observed by all men after their own fashion, the said prophet would doubtless have been hanged for his pains.

docs.snippet: EXAMINATION OF A JEWISH SUNDAY SCHOOL.--The Sunday School connected with the congregation of Reformed Jews "Emanu-El," worshipping in the church in 12th street, between the Third and Fourth avenues, was examined yesterday in the presence of Mr....
docs.lead_paragraph: EXAMINATION OF A JEWISH SUNDAY SCHOOL.--The Sunday School connected with the congregation of Reformed Jews "Emanu-El," worshipping in the church in 12th street, between the Third and Fourth avenues, was examined yesterday in the presence of Mr. LEVENTMTT, Vice-President, and the School Committee. The synagogue was very well attended by adult members of both sexes, and the proceedings were of a most interesting character.

docs.snippet: The following circular has been issued. The movement is a good one: SIR: The undersigned being engaged in the management of Prisons, and believing that much good might result from a Convention of all the Prison officers in the United States who could...
docs.lead_paragraph: The following circular has been issued. The movement is a good one: SIR: The undersigned being engaged in the management of Prisons, and believing that much good might result from a Convention of all the Prison officers in the United States who could conveniently attend, as well as such others as might feel interested in tile subject, have ventured to call such a Conven.

docs.snippet: A duel came off to-day, in North Carolina, between O. JENNINGS WISE, of the Enquirer, and PATRICK HENEY AYLETT, a contributor to the columns of the Examiner. Mr. AYLETT fired first. Mr. WISE then fired in the air, when Mr. AYLETT withdrew the...

headline.main: NEWS BY TELEGRAPH.; Duel between O. Jennings Wise and Patrick Henry Aylett.

docs.lead_paragraph: A duel came off to-day, in North Carolina, between O. JENNINGS WISE, of the Enquirer, and PATRICK HENEY AYLETT, a contributor to the columns of the Examiner. Mr. AYLETT fired first. Mr. WISE then fired in the air, when Mr. AYLETT withdrew the challenge, and asked for a reconciliation, which Mr. WISE refused.

docs.snippet: A letter from Tehuantepec, in the New-Orleans Picayune, says: "Mr. MURPHY's survey of Muatulco has demonstrated the entire practicability of that port for a coaling and water station; but the most interesting feature in this exploration of the...

headline.main: From Tehuantepec.; THE RUINS OF AN ANCIENT CITY.

docs.lead_paragraph: A letter from Tehuantepec, in the New-Orleans Picayune, says: "Mr. MURPHY's survey of Muatulco has demonstrated the entire practicability of that port for a coaling and water station; but the most interesting feature in this exploration of the Pacific coast of Mexico is the discovery of the ruins of an ancient city within a few miles of the sea.

docs.snippet: PROCEEDINGS OF THE BOSTON BAR. The Boston Atlas and Bee of yesterday has an interesting sketch of the life of RUFUS CHOATE. After a brief summary of the principal events in Mr. CHOATR'S career, the Atlas and Bee gives some particulars which have not...
docs.lead_paragraph: PROCEEDINGS OF THE BOSTON BAR. The Boston Atlas and Bee of yesterday has an interesting sketch of the life of RUFUS CHOATE. After a brief summary of the principal events in Mr. CHOATR'S career, the Atlas and Bee gives some particulars which have not been punished elsewhere.

docs.snippet: Just nineteen miles from the Battery, in the Lower Bay, there has t anchor, a trim shugeraft, the Florence Nightingale. When she dropped anchor, some two weeks ago, in the place where she is expected to ride out the Summer, she was called the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Just nineteen miles from the Battery, in the Lower Bay, there has t anchor, a trim shugeraft, the Florence Nightingale. When she dropped anchor, some two weeks ago, in the place where she is expected to ride out the Summer, she was called the Falcon.--a bulk admirably adapted to smother the miserable wretches that should fail within the experience of her cruel mercies.
